p: The high content of 1,8-cineole, α-terpineol and β-pinene in the seed oil of A. danielli in this study is likewise reported for the fruit oil of A. danielli (25.5–34.4%), β-pinene (14.1–15.2%) and α-terpineol (9.9–12.1%) from S. Tome [ 6]. Similarly, Adegoke et al. [ 5] recorded 1,8-cineole (59.8%), β-pinene (13.2%) and α-terpineol (9.3%) in high proportions for A. danielli seeds from Nigeria; while 1,8-cineole (48.9%) was shown for A. danielli seeds from Cameroon [ 4].
